extends javax.swing.JFrame
    See Also:

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GUI()
      Default constructor, creates a window at point 100,100 with a size of 400,400.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI()
        Default constructor, creates a window at point 100,100 with a size of 400,400. Uses the computers default window style, Adds all buttons and the drawing area to the window. Also populates drawn_Shapes with default data

      • GUI

        public GUI​(java.io.File file)
        Creates a new instance of the GUI, this has an input as this is called when the load file is called which needs a path. This will display the VEC file when loaded initially.
        Parameters:
        file - - File object that is to be loaded

    • Method Detail

      • drawing_area

        private void drawing_area()
        Creates the user input drawing area, adds a mouse listener and a mouse motion lister to the panel. Then adds the panel to the GUI frame.

      • keep_aspect

        private void keep_aspect()
        Maintains the aspec ratrio to whatever size is drawn. Keeps an aspect ratio of 1:1.

      • MouseClicked

        private void MouseClicked​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
        Gets the position of the mouse when the click occoured. If the user has the polygon tool selected, the coordinates that were clicked are added to the current instance of the polygon shape. If the coordinates added to the polygon is within 10 pixels in any direction of the starting coordinates. The newest coordinates are set to the starting postion and the polygon is completed.
        Parameters:
        event - - The event that triggered the mouse listener.

      • MouseReleased

        private void MouseReleased​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
        Gets the current x and y coordinates of the mouse when the event occoured. If any tool besides the polygon tool is selected, the shape is added to drawn_Shapes. This occours as with any shape besides the polygon is drawn with dragging and releasing the mouse, whereas the polygon requires clicks as each vertex. The entire drawing area is then repainted to update for the shape just added.
        Parameters:
        event - - The event that triggered the mouse listener.

      • Zoom

        private void Zoom​(java.awt.event.MouseWheelEvent e)
        Increase or decreased the zoom depending on which way was scrolled.
        Parameters:
        e - - mouse scroll event.

      • Tool_Buttons

        private javax.swing.JPanel Tool_Buttons()
        Creates a JPanel containing the tools in the program. Additional tools buttons are added by adding another image file to the tool_Buttons variable.
        Returns:
        - JPanel containing all the tool buttons in a column contain all the tools

      • File_Buttons

        private javax.swing.JPanel File_Buttons()
        Creates a JPanel containing the File buttons of the program: Save,Load and Undo currently. Additional File buttons are added by adding another image file to the file_Buttons variable.
        Returns:
        - JPanel containing all the File buttons in a row.

      • Colour_Buttons

        private javax.swing.JPanel Colour_Buttons()
        Creates a JPanel containing the quick access colours as-well as the no-fill and colour palette buttons. Additional quick access colours can be added by adding more colours to the colour_Buttons variable. The buttons are displayed in 2 rows with the columns growing as necessary.
        Returns:
        - JPanel containing all the File buttons in a row.

      • buttons_Create

        private void buttons_Create()
        Adds the JPanels returned from the above functions and adds them to the JFrame.

      • get_dim

        private int get_dim​(java.lang.String text)
        Ensure the users input is a integer but calling itself if it throws a non integer exception.
        Parameters:
        text - - Message displayed in the dialog box.
        Returns:
        - Dimension of exported BMP file

      • export_BMP

        private void export_BMP()
        Exports a bmp format to the user specified location with the specified resolution. Exports what is currently drawn on the screen.

      • Add_Colour

        public void Add_Colour​(draw_Type type)
        Adds the fill or pen colour change to drawn_shapes. It is added to drawn_Shapes as this will allow undo to simply delete the last member of drawn_Shapes to function. THis also makes saving easier as all objects are in one list, and order does not to be kept track.
        Parameters:
        type - - draw_Type enum specifying what the selected colour is te be used for, either fill,pen or turn off the fill.

      • add_Polygon

        public void add_Polygon​(java.lang.String[] data)
        Adds a polygon shape to drawn_Shapes, cannot use add_shape as polygon is saved differently and polygon can be any length.
        Parameters:
        data - - Specifying string of data to be added to a polygon instance. Format = {"POLYGON" "0.2565789473684211" "0.2975609756097561" "0.3355263157894737" "0.7268292682926829" "0.6973684210526315" "0.5902439024390244" "0.7335526315789473" "0.28780487804878047"}

      • polygon_Ending_Check

        private boolean polygon_Ending_Check()
        Checks if the latest point of the polygon is withing 10 pixels in any direction of the starting point
        Returns:
        - True or false.

      • polygon_Complete

        private void polygon_Complete()
        Completes the polygon and adds it to the drawn_Shapes variable. Changes polygon_Completed to true, then replaces the last coordinates of the polygon to the starting coordinates, then adds to drawn_Shapes. Finally, clears "polygon" ready for the next polygon to being.

      • add_Shape

        public void add_Shape​(shape_Type tool,
                      double x1,
                      double y1,
                      double x2,
                      double y2)
        Adds the shape specified by tool and the coordinates to the drawn_shape variable. If the shape is a users input the values are edited into vec format by dividing by the current height and width of the drawing area respectively. If the shape is loaded from a file the values are not effected
        Parameters:
        tool - - enum of the shape that is being added.
        x1 - - First X-coordinate of shape
        y1 - - First Y-coordinate of shape
        x2 - - Second X-coordinate of shape
        y2 - - Second Y-coordinate of shape

      • undo

        public boolean undo()
        Undoes the last action in drawn_Shape, excluding change of fill or pen colours. Undoes by removing the last index from drawn_Shapes, also sets x,y previous and current values to -1 so the shape last drawn does not appear. Drawing area is then repainted to remove the latest object from the drawing area.
        Returns:
        - Boolean returning if undo was successful.

      • find_Path

        private java.io.File find_Path​(java.lang.String extension)
        User browses system explorer to place file. Other VEC files can be selected to save over. Only Folders and VEC files are shown in the explorer.
        Parameters:
        extension - - The file extension that is displayed to the user.
        Returns:
        - File object to the location the user selected in the popup interface.

      • save_File

        public boolean save_File​(java.io.File directory_Path)
        Saves all objects in the drawn_Shapes variable. Saves to the location returned by find_Path().
        Parameters:
        directory_Path - - Used to specify a path for testing, not used in GUI mode.
        Returns:
        - Boolean stating if save was successful.

      • read_Line

        public java.lang.String read_Line​(java.util.Scanner sc,
                                  boolean testing)
        Reads a line of the file specified by sc and adds it to drawn_shape using the correct method. E.G. polygon uses add_Polygon(). If in testing mode the function returns the exception string, else it will display an alert in GUI operation
        Parameters:
        sc - - Scanner object for the file being read.
        testing - - boolean checking if the function is in testing mode.
        Returns:
        - Return error message in string format for testing purposes. Not used in GUI mode.

      • load_File

        private void load_File()
        File explorer interface where user selects a VEC file to load. Only VEC files and folders are displayed A new instance of the GUI is then created which displays the selected VEC file.

      • new_loaded_file

        private void new_loaded_file​(java.io.File chosenFile)
        Display the selected VEC file. This function loads the VEC file into the JPanel.
        Parameters:
        chosenFile - - File object of the selected file.

      • new_Drawn_Shapes

        private void new_Drawn_Shapes()
        Emptys drawn_Shapes object and adds the two default values of: BLACK pen colour Null fill colour

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main of the GUI class.
        Parameters:
        args - - input arguments
